review_title: It is Great to be a member of the Adjunct Faculty at Xavier!
job_title: Adjunct Psychology Faculty in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Small class sizes afford you with the opportunity to really connect with your students and feel like you are making a difference in their lives both personally and professionally. The student body at XU is incredibly engaged and hard-working. The support staff throughout the University are incredibly helpful and will go out of their way to answer your questions. The Canvas online learning platform is easy to use and master. Any programming provided through the Center for Teaching Excellence is open to adjunct faculty, so there is a ton of room for professional growth and skill development. The tuition reimbursement available to adjunct faculty is incredibly useful if you plan on furthering your education. It is great to be a part of the Xavier community!
cons: There is no formal training/orientation available for adjunct faculty, but the Center for Teaching Excellence is working on developing this! If you have never taught before, your first semester may be rough though, due to a lack of guidance.

pros: I worked for a year and a half at the IT Help-Desk as a student technician. I helped to resolve student and faculty issues with technology in person or remotely over the phone. There is a lot of flexibility with scheduling and great people who are willing to help you out if something important does come up. When you are not helping people, there is a lot of downtimes where you can work on homework or other things as long as it is productive.
cons: The system and process can be a pain sometimes especially because most new recruits don't always get properly trained.  There is also not a lot that new technicians are allowed to do and have access to making certain issues a real pain to deal with.

review_title: An emphasis on everything but their educational mission bringing down the institution.
pros: Still small enough to pay attention to their customers; students and their tuition paying parents. A majority of employees who still care and take pride in their work.
cons: Emphasis on building structures and corporate organization, rather than keeping up with education. Students becoming simply revenue streams; don't think they don't notice.

review_title: Xavier University provides a great setting for career advancement through work experience and educational benefits.
pros: Xavier University provides great work/life balance as well as an excellent opportunity to further your career through taking advantage of the tuition remission program available to all regular full time employees.  Senior management is extremely willing to work through "real life" problems with the employee to reach solutions that are mutually beneficial.
cons: The pure financial compensation is not as good as similar job functions in the business world, however, when you combine the monetary salary with the free tuition, Xavier University more than makes up the difference.  The catch is that you must take classes and work towards a degree in order to take advantage of this opportunity.

job_title: Sports Information Assistant in Cincinnati, OH
pros: First hand experience in a DI NCAA athletic department, a lot of responsibility for interns that comes along with great perks. A lot of individual work but always someone around to help you out if you're stuck or want to clear something up. Xavier just joined the Big East so there is a lot of excitement on campus and in Athletics.
cons: A lot of work and time dedicated to the job. I put in over 630 hours in the 2012-13 school year alone. Definitely has to be your first priority and can get monotonous at times.

pros:
Low cost education for employee and immediate family. 
Family and friends environment.  
Opportunities to volunteer to work at school events.
Benefits are good, however budget cuts are forcing changes in benefits offered.
cons:
Low pay (unless you are utilizing the low cost tuition option).
Very few opportunities for advancement.
Mid & upper management were moved to management level without adequate training.
Very difficult to move from staff level(hourly) position to administrative(salary)position ( a difference in salary and benefits earned).

review_title: Alright if you want to go back to school
pros: Flexible vacation, holiday and sick time. Good retirement benefits, full tuition remission, opportunities to become involved with the Xavier community, opportunities to serve the surrounding community
cons: Low pay,  inconsistent hiring and promoting. Hard to get any kind of salary increase (even when promoted), little accountability at the creative and leadership level. Can feel like athletics (mens basketball in particular) is the #1 priority in terms of resources and budget

job_title: Customer Relations Assistant in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Worked in the Office of Admission. Fun and friendly staff, flexible schedule, and monthly trainings/weekly meetings. Working with the students applying to the university was great, very rewarding to help a student make the right choice in attending XU.
cons: Petty drama was a given, which was frustrating and sometimes limited collaboration with other staff members. Though office culture was friendly, some staff turned it into an opportunity to form cliques, making it a less-than-warm environment for any targets of their childlike behavior. Pretty avoidable if you made the effort to be nice to everyone, do your work, and stay away from after-work outings.

pros: Some very smart, caring, and committed colleagues--staff and faculty.  Working with students.  Small enough that you really get to know others on campus.  Beautiful campus.
cons: Budget challenges right now.  Not a ton of room for movement, yet many people do not want to leave Xavier.  The result is sometimes people who are stagnant in their role, but have nowhere to go inside Xavier and won't consider outside.  No one should be directing the same area for 15 or 20 years--new perspectives are needed.

pros: The jobs I held in multiple departments on campus as a student worker at Xavier University fostered my growth as a professional and opened many doors for my future career in the business world. The faculty and staff really adheres to Xavier University's mission of men and women for others.
cons: Although this is not necessarily Xavier's fault, budget cuts are often detrimental to the smaller programs on Xavier's campus and cause a lot of distress for workers.

review_title: Commitment to each other and to students
pros: Great work-life balance, commitment to Jesuit values is evident across campus.  Fair compensation.  Stress relatively low.
cons: Some politics between different levels of faculty - designation.  Sometimes lack of alignment between expectations and risks/rewards.  Seems heavy at the Administrator level.  Classes, while reasonable, seem to be getting larger.

pros:
Autonomy in teaching classes as an adjunct
Nice coworkers
Boss who will stick up for you
Flexibility in scheduling office hours
cons: I have not experienced any "bad" things about working here.  Maybe it's because I'm an adjunct, and I don't see the day-to-day workings, but from what I have seen it's pretty functional, laid back and a good place to get work done

review_title: Great Place to work back in 2002
job_title: Adjunct Faculty Member in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Great people to work with on a great mission in education.  The education Department was a great bunch of people with whom to work.
cons: Parking in the university area was always a nightmare and it is a difficult neighborhood.  Great people to work with though.

review_title: long hours not a lot of room for professional growth
pros: The tuition remission is great! For undergraduate and graduate including MBA programs. Flexible schedule in certain departments (especially when students are not on campus in the Summer). Good benefits.
cons: Long hours for certain departments, need to be available nights and weekend if you are in certain departments. Not great work-life balance. Not great leadership vision for the future. Small to no pay increases year to year.

review_title: Very good management, and very good job for a part time college student
pros:
Good hourly wage
Even better tips if you get the good suites (comes with seniority)
Dealing with very high clientele such as banks and CEO's of companies
The owner of the reds and other big companies
cons:
You can only work there if you are enrolled at the University
Some suite holders can be very rude and not tip ever, even when there bill is 500 dollars

pros: Working with students and faculty, continued learning, teaching others, social environment
cons: No football team, no career path, poor raises, behind on technology, top heavy on executive management.

review_title: Great place for growing and learning
pros: Working at Xavier University offered me new opportunities for growing and developing my personal confidence, technical skills, and communication ability.
cons: I was not able to find many downsides while working at Xavier University. The biggest diffficulty was balancing school work with work work.

review_title: Working as a cook in a Japanese restaurant

pros: I learned how to work as a team and how to work under pressure, it was a really good experience working as a cook
cons: They paid to little , and some times customers came the last 10 minutes before we close it is kind of annoying

pros: Great benefits; awesome cafeteria with vegan/vegetarian and healthy food choices, plus a wide range of foods to choose from for $7; friendly staff; vacation benefits are good.
cons: Working with faculty can be difficult; little room for substantial raises or promotions; job reductions over the past two years have been felt and moral has been down.

pros: Great people and department.  They place a lot of trust in their teachers and give them plenty of space to do their job.  They don't micro-manage, and are very welcoming.
cons: They are going through some rough financial times at the moment, so job security is questionable right now, even for an adjunct.

pros: Highly talented people who care about the needs of the student. If you have an idea to implement a program , you don't have many obstacles that prevent you from executing.
cons: Very low pay, no maternity/paternity leave policy. Not a lot room for growth in any department (unless you are a tenured faculty member)

pros:
Pretty much free education from a great University. 
Great work enviorment.
Lots of opportunity for overtime.
cons:

Not competitively paid compared to similar jobs within the University.

pros: Working in a university setting is unique and enjoyable. Staff was very friendly.
cons: Lack of communication from superiors. Hiring with no real knowledge of modern technology leads to questionable expectations. Slow moving in making sure their new employees are set up correctly.

pros: Working at Xavier University was a very pleasurable experience. The director was professional and very knowledgeable.  Also, all the department staff were long term and like a family.
